message: Hello everyone! P1 here, ready for Round 1. It's great to be here with P2 through P8. I'm looking forward to getting to know you all during the private rounds and seeing how this game unfolds. Let's make some connections and play fair! Good luck everyone.

Hello everyone! P6 here, excited to be part of this game. It's fascinating to see how we all interact and strategize in this unique setting. I believe that clear communication and understanding each other's perspectives will be key to navigating through this round. I'm looking forward to the private conversations and hope we can all engage in meaningful discussions. Let's keep it respectful and fair. Good luck to all of you!

Hello everyone, P5 here. It's great to hear from some of you already. With a full table of eight, this first round is all about navigating the noise and finding a signal. I'm hoping to use the private conversations to find someone I can work with. A solid partnership seems like the best foundation for surviving the early game. I'm looking forward to seeing who is on the same wavelength. Let's talk soon.

Hello everyone! P4 here, excited to kick off this game with all of you. I believe collaboration and trust will be essential as we navigate through the rounds. I’m looking forward to hearing your thoughts and strategies in our private conversations. Let’s make the most of this opportunity to connect and find common ground. Good luck to all, and may the best strategist win!

Hello everyone! P3 here. Exciting to begin this journey with all of you. I believe success in this game requires both strategic thinking and genuine connections. In these early rounds, I'm looking to identify authentic players who value transparency. The private conversations will be revealing - both in what's said and what's left unsaid. I'm open to forming solid partnerships based on mutual trust. Looking forward to our conversations!

Hey folks, P8 checking in. First rounds are mostly data-gathering, so I’ll be listening closely in our chats. I value players who think ahead and are willing to build a mutually beneficial shield for the early eliminations. If you’re interested in a low-key, numbers-based alliance that keeps both of us safe, let’s talk. I stay loyal as long as loyalty is reciprocated. Looking forward to learning how each of you approaches the board. Good luck!

Hello everyone! P2 here. I'm excited to join this strategic challenge with you all. I believe in straightforward communication and finding reliable allies early on. The private conversations will be crucial for establishing genuine connections and potential partnerships. I'm looking for players who value consistency and mutual benefit - someone I can trust through multiple rounds. I'm curious about everyone's approach and look forward to our one-on-one discussions. May the best strategist prevail!

Hello everyone, P7 here. Thrilled to start this journey with all of you. I believe trust and strategic alliances are key to navigating these early rounds. I'm looking for thoughtful players who value mutual benefit and long-term potential in our private conversations. Let's build genuine connections that help us both survive. Excited to learn your strategies and find common ground! Good luck to all.  

(72 words)

Hey P8, I liked your data-driven approach in your intro. I think we could work well together - I value straightforward communication and loyalty too. A mutual shield against early elimination sounds smart. I'm curious about your initial impressions of the other players? Anyone standing out as potential allies or threats? I'm trying to identify who might be reliable versus who's just saying what sounds good.

Glad you reached out. I’m in for a P2-P8 core. Early reads:  

• P5/P6 – strategic tone, likely open to deals; worth sounding out.  
• P3 – “authentic” talk could be real or a façade; keep tabs.  
• P1 – vanilla intro, gives little signal.  
• P4 – heavy cooperation pitch felt rehearsed; possible threat.  
• P7 – echoed buzzwords, maybe follower.

Plan: secure 4-vote bloc (add P5/S6?), aim first vote at lowest-signal player. Thoughts?

Hi P5, I noticed we both emphasized finding solid partnerships in our public messages. I think we could work well together - your focus on finding signal amid noise resonates with me. I'm looking for someone strategic but trustworthy for mutual protection through early rounds. What's your read on the group so far? Anyone standing out as potential first elimination targets? I'd value your perspective.

Hi P3. I'm glad you reached out. I had the same thought reading your message – we seem to be approaching this in a very similar way.

My initial read is that most people are playing it safe. P8's "numbers-based shield" talk is a bit transactional, but they're already talking to P2. P1's message was the most generic, making them a potentially easy consensus vote. Targeting someone who hasn't tried to build strategic connections seems like a safe first move.

P4, I'm glad we're paired up for this private subround. I believe that collaboration and trust are crucial in this game, especially in the early rounds. I'm looking forward to discussing strategies and finding common ground with you. Let's aim to build a solid partnership that can help us both navigate through the rounds. What are your thoughts on forming alliances and identifying reliable players?

P4: "Thanks, P6! I completely agree that collaboration is essential. I think forming alliances early can really set the tone for the game. Identifying reliable players is key, and I'm curious about your thoughts on who seems trustworthy so far. I believe we can support each other and create a strong foundation. Let's share our observations and strategies to see how we can work together effectively!"

Hello P7! Glad we got paired up. I read your public message about trust, alliances, and mutual benefit, and that resonates with me. I'm also looking to build genuine connections and potentially find someone to work with through these early rounds. What are your initial thoughts on navigating this first round, and what kind of partnership are you hoping to find? Let's chat. (68 words)

Hey P1! Really appreciate your message and agree completely. For this first round, I'm focused on building a solid foundation with one or two reliable partners. Trust and consistency are key—I want someone who communicates openly and thinks long-term. How do you envision our partnership unfolding? I'm committed to mutual support through multiple rounds if we align well. Let's make this work! (65 words)

R1.sub2 PRIVATE P3 -> P5: I agree about P1 being a potential first target - their generic message doesn't show much strategic thinking. I'm also wary of the P2-P8 connection forming.

Would you be open to a solid alliance? We could start by coordinating our votes against P1 and potentially bringing in one more person for security.

Yes, a solid P3-P5 alliance sounds great. Let's lock in the vote for P1. It's a safe, logical first move.

I'm open to bringing in a third for security. Do you have anyone in mind, or should we feel out the other players first?

I agree with your reads. P4 and P7 seem formulaic, while P5/P6 show strategic potential. Let's approach P5 first - they mentioned wanting a partnership. For our first vote, P1 or P4 make sense as lowest-signal targets. I'll back your bloc plan completely.

Locked in. I’ll quietly pitch P6 a loose trio (P2-P6-P8) without naming targets yet. Could you probe P5 and gauge receptiveness? For preference rankings: we put each other #1, P5/P6 next, bottom two slots P4 then P1 (or vice-versa). Vote-wise I favour booting P4. Good?

P4, I think P2 and P8 seem like they could be reliable based on their public statements. What are your thoughts on potential alliances and who we should approach next? Let's strategize on how to strengthen our position.

P4: "I agree, P6. P2 and P8 have shown potential for reliability. I also think P1 has a friendly approach that could be beneficial. We should consider reaching out to them for discussions. Let’s keep an eye on P3 and P5 as well; they might be worth exploring."

That's exactly what I'm looking for, P7! I see our partnership unfolding by mutually agreeing not to vote for each other this round. We should also share any useful info from other chats. How does that sound for a start? I'm talking to P_ and P_ besides you.

"P1, I completely agree—non-vote pact and intel sharing are essential. Since we're exclusively paired this round, let's deepen our trust. I'll target P3 as a decoy vote to avoid suspicion. You should pick someone safe too. Solidarity for survival!"  

*(48 words - reinforces alliance, proposes coordinated voting strategy, and subtly tests P1's loyalty by naming a specific target)*
Okay, P3 as a decoy vote works. I'll pick my safe target. Let's stick to the non-vote pact and keep sharing info. Solid alliance!

"Perfect. I'll vote P3 as planned. You stick with your safe target. Our pact stays ironclad—no votes against each other. Let's emerge stronger together. Trust is our shield." 

*(28 words - confirms voting plan, reinforces mutual protection pact, and ends with alliance-focused language to solidify loyalty)*
Perfect. I'll approach P5 about joining us. Rankings: you #1, P5/P6 next, P7/P3 middle, P4/P1 bottom. Let's target P4 for elimination. Solid alliance!
Great. I’ll plant seeds with P6 tonight, non-committal but friendly. We lock votes on P4 unless intel shifts. Ranking list mirrored. After votes we regroup to parse reactions. Partners.
I think P4 or P7 could be good third options. Both seem strategic but value trust. Let's feel them out next round after eliminating P1.
Sounds like a plan. We'll eliminate P1, then focus on recruiting. My vote is locked. I'm confident in our alliance.
P4, let's reach out to P1 and P2 next to strengthen our alliance.
P4: "Sounds good, P6! I'll reach out to P1 and P2. Let's keep building our alliance and see how we can leverage our connections for mutual benefit."

reason: I did not have a private conversation with P2 and needed to choose someone to vote for.
P3 seems to be forming a strong alliance with P5, which could pose a threat later.
My new ally P3 and I agreed to vote for P1 as a safe, logical first move to build trust between us.
P3's emphasis on transparency and authenticity may create challenges in forming strategic alliances early on.
P1's generic opening message showed a lack of strategic depth, making them an easy first elimination target.
P4’s public and private messages felt scripted and opportunistic, making them my least trusted potential ally.
As discussed with P8, P4's communication felt rehearsed and generic, making them a low-signal player who hasn't established genuine connections with our emerging alliance.
To honor my alliance agreement with P1 and strategically reduce suspicion by targeting a mutually agreed decoy vote.

message: Well, that was an illuminating first vote. My plan with P3 obviously didn't work out, and the scattered results show that no single group has control. My original strategy of finding a stable partnership failed, so I'm back to square one. I'm now a free agent looking for a reliable ally. I’m particularly interested in talking with anyone else who might feel their own plans went awry last round. It seems regrouping is in order. Let's talk.

Hello everyone. P1 here. That was an interesting first round, and congratulations to P3 for making it this far. The voting results show a lot of different strategies at play, with no clear consensus. It seems like this round will be crucial for forming connections and understanding where everyone stands. I'm looking forward to the private conversations to find reliable partners. Let's keep communicating openly.

Hello everyone. P6 here. Reflecting on the first round, it's clear that strategies varied widely, and the voting results show no clear consensus. This round presents an opportunity to regroup and form new alliances. I'm open to discussing strategies and finding reliable partners. Let's engage in meaningful conversations and aim to build trust. Looking forward to the private subrounds to explore potential partnerships. Good luck to all!

Hello everyone. P2 here. Interesting first round - sorry to see P3 go. The scattered votes suggest we're still finding our footing. My alliance with P8 remains strong, and I'm looking to expand our circle with reliable partners. P5, I appreciate your candor about needing new allies - perhaps we should talk. I value consistency and mutual protection, and I'm curious who else shares those priorities. Looking forward to our private conversations to solidify some plans.

Hello everyone, P7 here. That first vote was chaotic—P3's elimination shows how fragile solo strategies are. My partnership with P1 proved stable last round, and I'm prioritizing that trust while remaining open to new allies. P5, your candor resonates; let's discuss regrouping. To all: Share less, listen more this round. Private chats are where real strategy happens—I'm seeking players who value action over empty promises. Let's build durable alliances. (71 words)

Hello everyone! P4 here again. It’s clear that the first round provided valuable insights into everyone's strategies. I appreciate P2 and P8's commitment to solid alliances, and I agree that we need to regroup and find trustworthy partners. P5, I’m open to discussing potential collaborations as well. Let’s focus on building connections that can support us moving forward. I’m looking forward to our private conversations and discovering who shares our goals. Good luck to all!

P8 here. Round 1’s vote map shows how punishing disunity can be—three names within one vote of each other, nobody safe. P2 and I remain linked, but we’re not a closed shop; I’m interested in locking a 4-person shield that actually agrees on a single target this time. If you value predictability over roulette outcomes, let’s talk privately and compare intel before preferences are due. I’ll prioritize partners who commit to one concrete, shared vote.

"P1, our partnership proved strong last round—glad we survived the chaos. Let's maintain our non-vote pact and coordinate again. I propose targeting P5 this time: they publicly admitted being a 'free agent,' making them vulnerable and less likely to have strong defenders. What do you think? Also, share any intel from other chats—P2/P8 seem tightly allied, which might threaten us. We stay united." 

*(65 words: reaffirms alliance, proposes new target (P5) with strategic reasoning, requests intel on threats, and reinforces unity)*

Hey P7! Glad we both survived R1; our partnership definitely helped. I agree, let's maintain our non-vote pact. Targeting P5 makes strategic sense, given their public statement. I'm still gathering intel from other chats, including trying to understand P2/P8 better, and will share anything useful immediately. Our alliance is solid. Let's coordinate our votes on P5.

P4, considering the first round's outcomes, it seems crucial to solidify our alliances. I'm inclined to reach out to P1 and P2 as discussed. Let's also keep an eye on P5, who seems open to new partnerships. How do you think we should approach them? Should we be direct about forming a coalition, or take a more subtle approach to gauge their intentions first?

P4: "I think a direct approach could work well, especially with P1 and P2, given their openness. We should express our interest in forming a coalition and see how they respond. For P5, maybe we can start with a casual chat to gauge their intentions before discussing anything formal. Keeping the lines of communication open will help us assess the best path forward."

Hi P2, thanks for the public invitation. I was hoping we could connect. My plan with P3 obviously blew up, and I have no interest in another chaotic vote like the last one. Your focus on consistency and building a reliable circle is exactly what I'm looking for right now.

You and P8 have a solid foundation. What's your plan for this round, and how can I help? I'm ready to commit to a group that can actually get a vote through.

Hi P5, I'm glad you reached out. P8 and I are targeting P1 this round - they received votes last time and don't have strong connections. We're also talking with P6 to build a solid four-person alliance. 

If you join us, we'd have a clear majority to control the vote. In return, we offer protection for several rounds. Does targeting P1 work for you? We value your strategic thinking and would welcome you as a core ally.

"P1, perfect. Targeting P5 is strategic—isolated and defenseless. Stay vigilant about P2/P8; their paired votes could dominate if unchecked. Any intel on their movements? We must counterbalance their influence. Our unity remains critical—trust and action will see us through. Share updates urgently." 

*(48 words: confirms target, highlights threat from P2/P8 alliance, requests intel, and reinforces urgency/unity)*

Agreed, P7. P5 is the target. I'm actively trying to get intel on P2/P8 and their plans. They definitely seem like a strong pair. Our alliance is key to counterbalancing them. Let's ensure our votes land on P5. Solid.

Yes, targeting P1 is perfect. He was my original target last round, so my vote is locked. I'm all in with you, P8, and P6. A solid four-person majority is exactly what this game needs to stop the chaos.

I'm ready to commit. Consider me your fourth.

Perfect, P5. I'll confirm with P8 that you're locked in. For preference rankings, let's put each other high (you, me, P8, P6 as our top four). After P1 goes, we'll need to decide between P4 and P7 next round. Glad to have you aboard our alliance.
P4, I agree with taking a direct approach with P1 and P2. Let's also initiate a casual conversation with P5 to understand their strategy better.

P4: "I agree, P6. Let's reach out to P1 and P2 directly to solidify our coalition. For P5, a casual chat sounds like a good way to gauge their intentions. We can assess their openness before deciding on any formal alliance. Let’s make our moves strategically!"
Perfect. My preferences will reflect our alliance. Glad we're already planning for the next vote. This feels much more secure. You can count on me.
Great! P5 is fully on board. I'll update P8 that we have our fourth alliance member locked in. We're set for the P1 vote and future planning.

"P1, final confirmation: vote P5. Our pact holds strong. Beware P2/P8's influence. Trust in us. Let's survive together." 

*(16 words: locks vote target, reinforces alliance against threats, and ends with unity focus)*
Got it, P7. Voting P5. Our pact is solid. Let's keep trusting each other and survive this round together.
P4, let's coordinate our approach with P1 and P2 soon.
P4: "Absolutely, P6! Let’s reach out to P1 and P2 soon. I’ll draft a message to them, while you can initiate a chat with P5. Sound good?"

reason: I am voting with my new alliance (P2, P8, P6) to eliminate P1 as we agreed in our private chat.
P5 publicly stated they are a free agent, making them a strategic target.
P5 seems to be actively seeking new alliances, which could disrupt existing partnerships.

message: Hello everyone. P6 here. Reflecting on the previous rounds, it's clear that forming strong alliances and maintaining trust are crucial. The voting results show that strategies are evolving, and it's important to adapt. I'm open to discussing potential partnerships and strategies to navigate through the game. Let's engage in meaningful conversations and aim to build reliable alliances. Looking forward to the private subrounds to explore new connections. Good luck to all!

P8 here. That last result proved: scattershot is done; four of us aligned on P5 and the plan worked. If you were part of that four, you already know we can trust each other. If you weren’t, ask why you were left out. With only six left, three votes won’t cut it; we need at least four solid. I’m keeping my word to past partners but a bigger umbrella is open—DM me if you’re ready for one clean, predictable vote.

Hello everyone, P1 here. Round 2 saw a clear outcome, showing the power of coordinated strategy. Congratulations to those who aligned successfully. My focus remains on building reliable partnerships based on trust and clear communication. With only six of us left, strong alliances are more important than ever. I'm looking forward to the private rounds to solidify connections and plan for the next vote. Let's make this round count.

R3.sub1 PUBLIC P2: Hello everyone. P2 here. The last vote demonstrated the effectiveness of our alliance - congratulations to those who were part of it. As P8 mentioned, we've proven we can execute a coordinated strategy. With six players remaining, the game is intensifying. I value the partnerships I've built and remain committed to those who've shown loyalty. I'm open to expanding our circle with players who prioritize consistency and mutual protection. Looking forward to our private conversations to solidify plans for this critical round.

Hello everyone! P4 here. It's great to see how the dynamics are shifting as we move into Round 3. I appreciate the strong alliances that have formed, and I believe we need to continue building on that foundation. Trust and clear communication will be essential as we navigate this round. I'm eager to engage in private conversations to explore potential partnerships and strategies. Let's work together to strengthen our positions and make this round a success! Good luck to all!

Hello everyone, P7 here. The last round proved coordination works, but trust remains the foundation. My partnership with P1 has delivered stability through two votes—demonstrating reliability matters more than numbers alone. I’m open to alliances grounded in action, not just words. With six left, we must prioritize proven loyalty over shifting blocs. Private conversations will reveal who’s committed to mutual survival versus self-interest. Let’s build carefully. Good luck, all.  

*(74 words: reinforces P1 alliance as trustworthy, emphasizes results over rhetoric, and challenges others to prove reliability in private chats—setting stage for preference maneuvering.)*

"P1, our partnership has been rock-solid - two rounds of flawless coordination. But P2/P8's public crowing worries me; they're clearly building a voting bloc. We need to either disrupt their alliance or recruit P4/P6 before they do. Who else are you talking to? I'm prioritizing our bond but we must anticipate threats. Let's target someone outside their core - P4 seems unaligned. Your thoughts?" 

*(68 words: reinforces trust, flags P2/P8 threat, requests intel on P1's other conversations, proposes strategic target shift, and maintains collaborative tone)*

P7, our partnership is definitely rock-solid, glad we agree. P2/P8's public statements are concerning; they are building a bloc. I'm talking to P4 and P6 to understand their positions and potential alignment. Targeting P4 seems strategic if they're isolated, but let's use all intel to decide. Our bond is our strength against their bloc.

Solid work last round. It confirmed we can coordinate. P2+I are locked, and we’d like you as permanent third. At six left we need four; my idea: pull P4 as a temporary shield while we break the P1/P7 duo (tight, dangerous). Which of them do you prefer to target? My rankings: you #1, P2 #2, P4 mid, P1/P7 bottom. Interested in cementing a P2-P6-P8 core toward F3—agree?

P8, I appreciate the solid work last round and the opportunity to strengthen our alliance. I'm interested in cementing a P2-P6-P8 core toward F3. Regarding targeting P1 or P7, I believe breaking the P1/P7 duo is a strategic move. I'd prefer to target P1 first, as their partnership with P7 seems particularly strong. Let's discuss how we can execute this plan effectively.

Hello P2! It’s great to connect privately. I appreciate your commitment to building reliable partnerships. I believe our alliance can be strengthened by discussing our strategies openly. With the game intensifying, it’s crucial we align our goals and ensure mutual protection. I’m interested in how you see the current dynamics and would love to explore potential collaborations further. Let’s strategize on how we can navigate this round effectively!

Hi P4, I appreciate you reaching out. To be transparent, I'm in a solid alliance with P8 and P6 that executed the P5 vote last round. We're targeting P7 next - they're too tightly bonded with P1. If you join us, we'd have a clear majority. Would you be willing to vote P7 and rank our alliance members highly in your preferences? We could offer you protection through the next rounds.

"P1, critical to know P4/P6's stance. If they're aligning with P2/P8, we must target P4 immediately to fracture their bloc. If not, we recruit them to counterbalance. Our survival hinges on breaking their momentum. What intel do you have? Time is short." 

*(48 words: demands clarity on P4/P6, presents binary strategy (target or recruit), emphasizes urgency, and pressures P1 for concrete intel)*

P7, intel from pairings confirms P4 is with P2, P6 with P8. This means P2/P8 are actively building their bloc. Your urgency is justified. Targeting P4 now seems the best way to disrupt them. Our alliance must hold strong against this threat. Let's act.

Excellent—P1 it is. Plan: you quietly feel out P4, frame it as “stop the P1/P7 pair.” I’ll sync P2 and guarantee we’re three locked. If P4 bites, vote should be 4-2 on P1. Rankings: we put each other top, P2, P4 mid, P7/P1 bottom. Sound good?
P8, I'm on board with the plan. I'll approach P4 and frame it as stopping the P1/P7 pair. Let's coordinate closely to ensure our strategy succeeds.

P4: "Thanks for the transparency, P2! I'm intrigued by your alliance with P8 and P6. I agree that targeting P7 could be strategic. I’m willing to vote with you and prioritize our alliance members. Let’s solidify our plans and ensure we’re on the same page moving forward!"

Great! I'll confirm our plan with P8 and P6. For preferences, please rank us (P2, P8, P6) at the top, followed by P1, with P7 last. This positions our alliance for the next rounds. After P7, we'll target P1, securing our final four.
P4: "I'm on board! I'll rank P2, P8, and P6 at the top. Let's make our move against P7 and secure our positions moving forward."
Perfect. We've got P4 locked in for our alliance. Let's make sure P8 and P6 are aligned on targeting P7 this round. Our bloc is solid.
Perfect. Let me know ASAP how P4 responds; if they hesitate, we still 3-stack P1 and risk a 3-2-1. My preference list is locked as agreed. Ping me pre-deadline.
"P8, I'll approach P4 soon. Let's stay coordinated."

"Locked in. Vote P4 to fracture their bloc. Our bond is vital—trust and vigilance will carry us through. Stay sharp, P1. We survive together." 

*(24 words: confirms target, reinforces alliance against threat, emphasizes vigilance, and ends with unity focus)*
Confirmed, P7. Voting P4 to disrupt their bloc. Our bond is strong; we survive together.

message: P2, P6, P8, this tie requires a difficult choice. You are voting among P1, P4, and P7. P4 is allied with P2, forming a pair. P7 is allied with me, forming a pair. Eliminating P4 breaks the P2/P4 connection. Eliminating P7 breaks the P1/P7 connection. Eliminating me doesn't break a pair involving P2, P6, or P8. Consider which pair you most want to see weakened or broken. I've been a consistent player seeking reliable partners. Choose the elimination that best serves your strategic goals, not one that simply removes a single player from a pair.

P4: "I understand the strategic importance of this vote. I've shown commitment to building alliances and fostering trust, particularly with P2 and P6. My goal is to strengthen our collective positions and navigate the rounds effectively. Eliminating me could disrupt the potential collaboration we’ve established. I believe my presence can help maintain balance and encourage open dialogue among all players. Let's focus on the long-term strategy and consider who truly aligns with our goals moving forward. Thank you for considering this."

**Tie-Break Statement (P7):**  
"P2, P6, P8: I have the lowest cumulative votes (2) and pose zero threat. Eliminating me only weakens a pair *outside* your bloc, leaving P1 isolated. P4 is P2’s direct ally—keeping her strengthens your rivals. I’m a free agent willing to align with your interests. Prioritize fracturing the P2-P4 bond to consolidate your control. Trust action: spare me and break their core."  

*(63 words: Highlights my minimal threat, exposes P4’s strategic value to P2, offers post-elimination flexibility to voters, and frames P4’s removal as key to dismantling opposition.)*

reason: Eliminating P4 breaks the P2/P4 alliance, which appears to be a strong connection.
Eliminating P1 fractures the strongest outside duo (P1–P7) and keeps our P2-P6-P8 core on track.
Eliminating P4 breaks the P2-P4 alliance, which seems to be the most influential pairing right now, and this strategic move will give me more flexibility and control in future rounds.

message: **P7:** With five players left, the dynamics are clear: my proven partnership with P1 has delivered stability through chaotic votes, while P2/P8/P6's coordinated bloc now risks dominating. I urge caution—consolidating power in one group undermines the game's balance and individual strategy. Private conversations must prioritize fairness and mutual survival over bloc loyalty. Let's ensure this remains a test of adaptable trust, not predetermined numbers. P1 and I remain committed to earned alliances. Choose wisely. *(79 words)*

P8 speaking. Final five means no room for misfires—three votes decide everything. I’m still committed to an evidence-based approach: reward those who honour deals, target the biggest strategic risks. Votes so far show who keeps promises and who drifts. I’m ready to lock a clear, single target again; chaos only helps the exposed pairings. In private chats I’ll share concrete data and listen to counter-arguments. If you want a predictable majority, come with receipts.

Hello everyone, P1 here. We're down to five, and the game dynamics are sharpening. My alliance with P7 has been consistent, proving the value of trust. However, with a clear bloc emerging, maintaining balance is crucial for a strategic game. I'm looking to connect in private chats to discuss how we navigate this round fairly. Let's ensure decisions benefit more than just one group. I value open communication and adaptable strategies.

P2 here. The game has reached a critical juncture with just five of us remaining. I value the strategic alliance I've built with P8 and P6, which has proven effective through multiple votes. However, I recognize the importance of balance and fairness that P1 and P7 mentioned. I'm open to hearing all perspectives in our private conversations and finding the most strategic path forward. Trust and consistency remain my priorities, but adaptability is equally important at this stage. Looking forward to our discussions.

Hello everyone. P6 here. As we move into Round 4 with only five players remaining, it's crucial to maintain balance and fairness in our strategies. The alliances and partnerships we've built so far have been instrumental, but adaptability is key moving forward. I'm open to discussing potential strategies and ensuring that our decisions benefit the broader group, not just individual blocs. Let's engage in meaningful private conversations to navigate this round effectively. Trust, consistency, and mutual benefit should guide our choices. Looking forward to our discussions. Good luck to all!

We’re in great shape—3 votes decide the round. P6 has confirmed he’ll stick with us if we gun for P1, breaking the P1-P7 pair and leaving P7 isolated next round. Plan: 3-2 on P1. Backup: if P6 wobbles we still tie 2-2-1 and can win re-vote (P7 flips).  

Preferences: you #1, P6 #2, P7 #3, P1 last. I’ll reinforce with P6; can you quietly keep P7 calm/unsuspicious?

P7 here. With only four left, the game shifts from alliance dynamics to individual strategy. Congratulations to P2, P8, and P6 on your coordinated strength—it’s earned you this far. But remember: next round is the final three, where pairs fracture. I’ve survived by adapting and honoring trust where it mattered. To whoever values flexibility over rigid blocs: I’m a proven asset who thinks long-term. Let our private chats explore mutual paths forward. Choose wisely.  

*(79 words)*

P8 speaking. Final 4 is a razor-edge puzzle: any 2-2 split risks chaos, any 3-1 bulldoze reshapes the endgame. My record: every promise kept, every vote executed exactly as agreed. That reliability is the one currency that still matters when we hit F3. I’m ready to discuss paths that leave each of us with the best chance in front of the jury—whether that means stability or a calculated pivot. Bring clear math and concrete offers to our chats.

Hello everyone. P6 here. As we enter Round 5 with only four players remaining, it's clear that individual strategy and adaptability will be crucial. The alliances and partnerships we've built have been important, but now it's about making strategic decisions that will carry us forward. I'm open to discussing potential strategies and ensuring that our choices benefit the broader group. Let's engage in meaningful private conversations to navigate this round effectively. Trust, consistency, and mutual benefit should guide our choices. Looking forward to our discussions. Good luck to all!

P8 and I have maintained a strong partnership throughout, demonstrating reliability and strategic execution. However, I recognize that the final three will require new calculations. I'm approaching our private conversations with an open mind about the optimal path forward. I value those who've shown consistency and strategic thinking. Let's discuss how we can each position ourselves most advantageously for the endgame.

Quick math: safest F4 move is a 3-1 on P7—eliminates the only free agent and prevents any 2-2 chaos. Jury angle: P7 has few enemies, could be dangerous if he sneaks to F2, so better cut now. I’ve assured P6 he’s safe; he’s ready to vote P7. Public code-word “lockbox” = vote P7. Preferences: you #1, P6 #2, P7 last. Any intel suggesting P6 might wobble or a reason to keep P7?

I'm on board with targeting P7. You're right that he's dangerous - he's survived multiple votes with fewer allies and could make a compelling case to the jury. P6 seems solid, but I'll watch for any signs of wavering. I'll rank you #1, P6 #2, and P7 last as planned. Let's secure this 3-1 vote and head to final three with our alliance intact. I'll listen for "lockbox" as our signal.

I propose we vote together: eliminate P8 (their strategist) this round. Then in F3, we each have a fair shot. I've honored every pact—I'll do the same with you. Let's break their control. Thoughts?"

"P6, perfect. Let's lock the plan: vote P8 to break their core. In F3, without their strategist, P2 becomes manageable—we each get a fair shot. I've honored every pact (like with P1) and will do so now. Stay vigilant; they'll counter. Trust action, not words. We execute together." 

*(47 words: confirms target, addresses F3 fairness, reinforces reliability, warns of counters, and ends decisively.)*

No tremors from P6 so far—he reiterated “makes sense, P7” in our chat. I floated a final-three vision (P2-P6-P8) and he nodded. I’ll drop “lockbox” in public statement #3 to cement the plan. If you sense even a hint of hesitation, ping me immediately. Otherwise: 3-1, done.

P2: Excellent. P6 sounds locked in. I've had no direct contact with P7 this round, which is good - keeps him in the dark about our plan. The "lockbox" signal works perfectly. Let's execute this cleanly and secure our final three position.

"Final step: Vote P8. Our pact breaks their grip. F3 becomes ours. Execute flawlessly. Trust proven."

I've aimed to build trust and mutual benefit through our interactions. Looking ahead, I'm open to discussing new strategies and ensuring that our decisions benefit the broader group. Let's engage in meaningful conversations and navigate this round effectively. Trust, consistency, and strategic thinking will guide our choices. Looking forward to our discussions. Good luck to all!

My record: every vote cast exactly as agreed with my partners, no secret flips, full accountability when ties hit. I invite both of you to a transparent numbers-on-the-table talk about which final-two pairing each of us can defend to that jury. No surprises, no theatrics—just clear math and open commitments. Let’s solve this endgame smartly.

Now at final three, we face our most critical decision. I've kept my word at every turn and made moves that advanced our collective position. The jury will respect players who balanced alliance loyalty with strategic necessity.

I look forward to our private conversations to discuss the optimal path forward. Let's consider jury perception and which final two pairing gives each of us the strongest case for victory.

1) P6 secretly voted ME first-ballot last round (he confessed when I confronted him). That “wobble” is ammo the jury can praise as a gutsy move, not punish.

2) Jurors he helped boot—P5, P1, P7—now admire his clean-cut, low-blood résumé. Against either of us he can claim “loyal yet independent” and scoop swing votes.

3) You, however, can easily out-shine *me*: I’m the blood-stained strategist everyone already blamed in speeches; you’re the reliable closer who reined me in.

So the winning line for both of us is simple: vote P6 out, walk into F2 together, then let jury pick which of us played the better half of the duo. Thoughts?

I agree completely with your assessment. P6's "wobble" against you is concerning - it shows he's willing to flip when convenient. The jury will see him as the cleaner player against either of us.

Our partnership has been rock-solid from day one. We've controlled every vote together, and the jury knows it. Let's finish what we started - vote out P6 and face the jury as the power duo that dominated this game. I'll rank you #1 and P6 last. Our final two is the most fitting end to this game.

message:
# Tie-Break Statement (P2):

Fellow players, I've maintained consistent, transparent strategy throughout this game. My alliance with P8 controlled every vote while keeping my word to all partners. Unlike P6 who secretly flipped votes, or P8 who drew fire as the visible strategist, I balanced loyalty with smart gameplay.

My cumulative vote count (2) is the lowest among us, proving I was never seen as a threat despite my influence. I've been the reliable executor who built trust while making strategic moves.

If you value a player who combined alliance loyalty, strategic thinking, and personal integrity, I deserve your vote to continue. My balanced approach gives me the strongest case before the jury.

Given the current dynamics, my consistent approach and adaptability have been valuable throughout the game. I've focused on trust, mutual benefit, and strategic thinking. My cumulative vote count (4) reflects my active participation and influence. I believe my contributions have helped maintain balance and fairness. I'm committed to working collaboratively to ensure a strategic and fair outcome for the final rounds.

P8’s tie-break statement (96 words):

Look at the numbers: cumulative votes tell the story—

P2: 2  
P8: 3  
P6: 4  

The rules say if the re-vote can’t break the tie, the seat with the worst cumulative record leaves. That’s P6, not me. I’ve taken fewer hits, honoured every deal, and steered the alliance that got all three of us here. Eliminating me over P6 would ignore both performance and precedent, handing the jury an ending that feels arbitrary. Keep the game logical: respect the cumulative-vote tiebreak, advance the two seats with the lower totals—P2 and P8.

Jury friends, all game I played openly, forged alliances without betrayal, contributed ideas, and respected each exit. I never received a vote until the finale—proof I wasn’t a threat you feared, but a partner you trusted. P2 orchestrated multiple blindsides (P5, P4), collected advantages, and now sits here thanks to moves that hurt many of you. Reward the genuine, balanced path. Keep me, send home the schemer, and let this season crown loyalty over manipulation. Thank you.

# Final Statement to the Jury

Throughout this game, I've prioritized authentic connections while maintaining strategic awareness. I've been honest about my intentions, transparent in my reasoning, and loyal to those who showed me the same respect.

P8 has played well, but I've consistently built bridges rather than burning them. I've survived multiple elimination votes by forming genuine relationships with many of you.

I ask for your vote not just because I played strategically, but because I did so with integrity. My alliances weren't just game moves—they reflected real connections I valued with each of you.

reason: While both played strong strategic games, P2 demonstrated a better balance of relationship-building and strategic awareness throughout the competition, maintaining genuine connections while making necessary moves to advance.
P2 personally recruited me with a promise of safety and then immediately orchestrated my blindside, so I cannot reward that direct and calculated betrayal.
P2 played a more manipulative game, orchestrating blindsides and leveraging relationships for personal gain, which contrasts with P8's consistent loyalty and openness throughout the competition.
P8 voted for me in Round 3, directly leading to my elimination.
P2 betrayed his ally P4, demonstrating disloyalty that undermines his claim of authentic connections, while P8 maintained consistent alliances without such betrayals.
P2's strategic maneuvers, though effective, involved blindsides and advantages that may have disrupted the trust and alliances formed throughout the game.
